intro: Chromatotriccum calyptratum, commonly known as the red-flowered sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its small, showy, red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, often found in desert scrub or chaparral habitats. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The species is noted for its ability to withstand arid conditions and is sometimes used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
